text: the black flag of Islamic state planted
on a hilltop near the Syrian town of
kobani to show they had regained this
key battleground but moments later this
happened a direct hit by an airstrike
sends militants running down the hill
one was reportedly killed this mountain
overlooking kobani has been fought over
for weeks as both sides battle for
control of this besieged border town it
was one of many airstrikes by coalition
warplanes
in and around kobani again and again
hitting jihadi targets this week for the
first time Americans dropped weapons and
supplies for Kurdish fighters here and
soon reinforcements are expected to join
them turkish President Recep tight arrow
unconfirmed Iraqi Peshmerga fighters
would travel across his country to join
the battle in kobani an agreement on a
figure of two hundred fighters has been
reached he said all this the Americans
say has improved the situation on the
ground or at the very least bought
Kurdish fighters there more time across
the border in Turkey more than a hundred
and thirty thousand Syrian refugees have
fled their homes space here at the
Zurich refugee camp is limited and some
families are living in abandoned
buildings I keep the Cardinal it's
getting colder at night especially for
kids this man says of course I'm afraid
of the winter because we have nothing
for those who remain here there is hope
but the overwhelming feeling is
uncertainty what is clear is what
happens here has become crucial for both
the Islamic state and its opponents
Laura Westbrook BBC News
